match.venue: Khan Shaheb Osman Ali Stadium, Fatullah

commentary.line: That's all we have for you from day 1 of the one-off Test between these two Asian nations. Tomorrow, Dhawan and Vijay will look to better their previous best opening partnership of 289 against Australia, but can they go past the world record of 415, made by Graeme Smith and Neil McKenzie? Join us tomorrow to find out, but don't forget play will start 30 minutes early tomorrow.

Vijay then survived a close LBW shout at the fag end of the day, only to be saved by an inside edge. Dhawan marched on and reached 150 just before the umpires decided to call stumps because of the fading light. Bangladesh tried seven bowlers during the course of the day but none of them were able to achieve a breakthrough. Although the odd one is turning and bouncing, the pitch is absolutely flat and the batsmen would enjoy batting on this surface on Day 2.

It rained, rained and rained and after almost four hours, play resumed with about 38 overs remaining in the day. The story was no different for Bangladesh even after the break as both the Indian openers batted freely. Vijay upped the ante and recorded his 11th Test fifty and Dhawan soon brought up his third Test match hundred. It was the first hundred for the left-handed batsman in 15 innings. The duo stretched their partnership past 200 and in the process recorded India's highest ever opening stand against Bangladesh in Tests.

239/0 in 56 overs after opting to bat first, India will take that with both hands. The fact that they scored at 4.27 runs per over explains their dominance. The pitch had hardly anything in it for the bowlers and both Shikhar Dhawan and Murali Vijay were able to score at will. The latter though survived a very close LBW shout in the second over of the day even before opening his account. However, as the morning progressed, the duo were able to find the gaps and Dhawan in particular, was severe on the bowlers. He raced to fifty off 47 balls, but had a nervy moment soon after as Shuvagata Hom dropped him just before the skies opened up.

The umpires have decided that the current light is not sufficient for play to continue and it's stumps on day 1. Dhawan and Vijay walk off after punching gloves with each other. A few Bangladeshi players walk up to Dhawan and congratulate him for his achievement.

55.6   T Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan gets to 150 with this single, this was a flighted delivery outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and drives it towards mid-off, sets off for a single and makes it comfortably

55.5   T Islam to Dhawan, 2 runs, Dhawan comes down the track, doesn't get to the pitch of the ball but goes through with the flick, the ball goes uppishly through mid-wicket, the fielder in the deep runs to his left, puts in the dive and saves a couple for his team
55.4   T Islam to Vijay, 1 run, quicker and on middle and leg stump line, Vijay goes deep in the crease and nudges it behind square on the leg-side for a single
55.3   T Islam to Vijay, no run, flighted delivery around off, Vijay leans forward and defends
55.2   T Islam to Vijay, no run, flatter and turning away on off, Vijay goes on the back foot and blocks
55.1   T Islam to Vijay, no run, darted full and on off, Vijay defends with his bat close to the pad
54.6   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Vijay waits inside the crease, opens the face of the bat and pushes it square of the wicket for a single

54.4   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, the ball keeps slightly low as Vijay mistimes the punch to silly mid-on
54.3   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, bowls this on a length and outside off, Vijay comes forward and defends it to cover
54.2   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, bowls this slightly wide outside off, Vijay punches it to the right of gully, can't get the single away
54.1   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, length ball outside off, Vijay opens the face of the bat and guides it to the left of gully, who gets across and stops the ball
53.6   T Islam to Vijay, 1 run, flatter from Islam, Vijay rocks back and knocks it to sweeper cover, he will keep the strike
53.5   T Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, advances and works this flighted delivery through mid-wicket to get off strike
53.4   T Islam to Dhawan, no run, comes down the track and defends this slowish delivery to silly mid-on
53.3   T Islam to Dhawan, no run, almost a catch! This was tossed up by Islam, Dhawan comes forward and drives it in the air towards silly mid-on, who dives but the ball bounces right in front of him
53.2   T Islam to Dhawan, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Dhawan takes a step forward and drives it to silly mid-on, who misfields but luckily for him, the batsmen don't take the single
53.1   T Islam to Dhawan, no run, floated up outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and drives it to the right of the bowler, who dives and stops the ball

Some tape is being applied to the edges of Vijay's bat. Meanwhile, the batsmen take a little drinks break of their own. It is very humid out there and Vijay changes his shirt as well. Umpire Llong is not pleased with this delay though

52.6   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, gives more width on offer this time, Vijay waits for it, opens the face of the bat and guides it to the right of gully, who dives and stops the ball, saved some runs for his team there
52.5   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, 1 run, drifts onto the pads this time, Dhawan works it away through square leg and gets to the other end
Shahid has been given an official warning for running on the danger area
52.4   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, just short of a good length and around off, Dhawan goes slightly across and punches it to silly mid-on
52.3   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Dhawan punches it towards cover

52.2   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Dhawan punches it towards mid-on and sets off for the single, Vijay was not interested and Dhawan has to rush back as the throw comes in at his end, he gets back comfortably
52.1   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Dhawan nudges it to short mid-wicket
There is some discussion going on between Vijay and umpire Llong. Not sure what it's about, but the umpire was showing the edge of the bat to the batsman for some reason
51.6   T Islam to Vijay, no run, pushed through by Taijul, Vijay goes back and defends it
51.5   T Islam to Vijay, no run, this one is given more air, Vijay prods forward and turns it towards the on-side
51.4   T Islam to Vijay, no run, flighted and on the stumps, Vijay goes back and turns it towards the on-side
A slip and a silly point for Vijay
51.3   T Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up and just outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and drives it to the right of extra cover, just a single

51.2   T Islam to Dhawan, FOUR, the reverse lap from Dhawan, this was tossed up and just outside off, Dhawan changed his position and runs it off the face of the bat, the keeper anticipated the shot and moved across to his left, but the ball was already past him
51.1   T Islam to Dhawan, no run, flighted delivery and just outside off, Dhawan was looking to dab it very late, gets a bottom edge that goes off the keeper's pads
Taijul Islam [9.0-0-44-0] is back into the attack
50.6   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Vijay prods forward and defends it

50.5   Mohammad Shahid to Vijay, no run, this is good bowling from Shahid, on a good length and holding its line outside off, Vijay was drawn into poking away from his body, beaten on the outside edge

50.4   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, 1 run, almost chopped on! This was slightly short and angled away from outside off, Dhawan lazily wafted at that, gets an inside edge past his leg-stump, just a single
50.3   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, on a good length and in that channel around off, Dhawan looks to drive and gets an inside edge towards the on-side
50.2   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, back of a length and on the stumps, clipped towards short mid-wicket
50.1   Mohammad Shahid to Dhawan, no run, back of a length and on Dhawan's pads, he looks to flick and misses, the ball races away off his thigh pad. Litton dives across and saves some runs
Mohammad Shahid [9.0-2-49-0] is back into the attack
Right, Rahim gets his pacer back and the batsmen have called for their helmets and thigh guards. A silly mid-on and a short mid-wicket is in place
49.6   Shakib to Dhawan, 1 run, Shakib gives this one more air, Dhawan comes down the track, plays it with the spin and beats mid-wicket for a single
49.5   Shakib to Dhawan, no run, tossed up and on the stumps, Dhawan comes down the track and whips it towards mid-wicket

49.4   Shakib to Dhawan, FOUR, that's easy pickings for Dhawan, flatter and well down leg-side, Dhawan rocks back, allows the ball to pass him and plays a half-arm pull, gets it very fine and beats fine leg to the fence
49.3   Shakib to Vijay, 1 run, tossed up and on Vijay's pads, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a single
49.2   Shakib to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted delivery and just outside off, Dhawan comes down the track and drives it to long-off for a single
49.1   Shakib to Dhawan, no run, flatter from Shakib, Dhawan comes down the track and punches it to silly mid-on
Drinks are on the field now. Indian openers are making merry in easy batting conditions. Vijay is nearing his three figure score as well. The bowling looks very average..
48.6   Kayes to Dhawan, 1 run, this one is given more air, driven down towards long-off for a single
48.5   Kayes to Vijay, 1 run, very full and just outside off, squeezed away behind square on the off-side for a single
48.4   Kayes to Vijay, no run, flighted and on the stumps, Vijay goes back and turns it towards square leg
48.3   Kayes to Vijay, no run, flatter and spinning into Vijay, he rides the bounce and defends it towards the on-side
Back to over the wicket. Just a short mid-wicket in place
48.2   Kayes to Dhawan, 1 run, Kayes drops one short and well outside off, Dhawan makes room and cracks it square on the off-side for a single
Fifth spinner for the day tried by Rahim, seventh bowler as well. Kayes changes to round the wicket
48.1   Kayes to Dhawan, no run, tossed up and just outside off, Dhawan goes back and pushes it towards the off-side
Imrul Kayes, comes into the attack

47.1   Shakib to Vijay, no run, tossed up and on the off-stump line, Vijay prods half forward and blocks

46.4   Hom to Vijay, 1 run, flighted delivery and on the off-stump line, driven down to long-on for a run
46.3   Hom to Vijay, no run, Hom tosses one on the leg-stump line, Vijay lunges forward and blocks
46.2   Hom to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up and on the stumps, Dhawan stays back and punches it towards long-on
46.1   Hom to Vijay, 1 run, flighted from round the wicket, Vijay goes back and nudges it behind square on the on-side for a single
45.6   Shakib to Vijay, 1 run, Shakib drifts one onto Vijay's pads, worked away behind square on the on-side for a single
45.5   Shakib to Vijay, no run, flighted delivery and on the pads, Vijay goes back and turns it towards the on-side

45.1   Shakib to Dhawan, 2 runs, tossed up and just outside off, Dhawan waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it through the vacant slip cordon, the keeper gave chase, but it's the man from the deep who gets around first, Dhawan is back for the second run
Shakib Al Hasan [6.0-0-23-0] is back into the attack
Just a silly mid-on in place for Dhawan
44.6   Hom to Vijay, no run, flatter and well outside off, Vijay stays back and punches it to the left of mid-off, he wanted a run but is sent back by Dhawan

44.2   Hom to Vijay, no run, loud shout for LBW, but looks like there was an inside edge on that, Vijay was caught in his crease as he went back to a skidder, ended up jamming his bat against the ball, there were two noises on that. Good call from umpire Llong
44.1   Hom to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted and on the stumps, driven towards deep mid-on for a single
This is the second time Vijay and Dhawan have put on 200 or more for the opening wicket. Their best is 289 against Australia in Mohali. That was Dhawan's debut Test

A FSL and a leg slip in place for Hom

40.4   Hom to Dhawan, 1 run, this one is given more air, eased down towards long-on for a single
40.3   Hom to Dhawan, no run, pushed through quicker, Dhawan goes back and defends it

40.1   Hom to Dhawan, no run, tossed up and coming back with the angle, Dhawan shimmies down the track and blocks

A slip and a silly mid-on in place

That will be drinks. It has been all India after play resumed after the rain break. Dhawan reached the three figure mark and Vijay has looked more comfortable as the innings has progressed. Bangladesh need wickets and few of them, else they will be on a leather hunt for a while.

35.4   Jubair Hossain to Dhawan, FOUR, third Test hundred for Dhawan, his first in 15 innings. It has been a happy return to the side for him. Takes out his floppy hat and raises his bat. 34.5   Hom to Dhawan, no run, comes down the track and Hom pulls the length back, Dhawan adjusts well and knocks it to cover

There is a third man in place now

The Indian openers stride out to the middle before the Bangladeshi players. Dhawan was wearing a floppy hat, but asked for a helmet soon after coming out. Taijul to complete his over. A slip and short leg in place..

15:03 Local Time, 09:03 GMT, 14:33 IST: Finally, some good news. There is an update that play will resume at 15:30 local which is less than 30 minutes away. If the weather and light permit, we will have 38 overs today.
14:40 Local Time, 08:40 GMT, 14:10 IST: Tea has been taken. Hopefully there is no more rain and we can have some play in the final session.
14:32 Local Time, 08:32 GMT, 14:02 IST: The umpires will have an official inspection at 15:00 local time. The super soppers are working on the outfield.

14:15 Local Time, 08:15 GMT, 13:45 IST: The rain has stopped now and the covers are slowly being removed. However, the outfield is very wet and the groundstaff need to work hard for play to resume again today. Meanwhile, the umpires walk out to assess the conditions.
13:40 Local Time, 07:40 GMT, 13:10 IST: Just as the groundstaff were removing the covers, the rain returned. The delay continues.

13:25 Local Time, 07:25 GMT, 12:55 IST: The heavy rain has eased, but it is still drizzling. Even after it stops it will take plenty of time to get the ground ready. In fact, as I was typing that, the rain has stopped.

12:55 Local Time, 06:55 GMT, 12:25 IST: Nothing much to update. It is still raining and the covers are in place. The groundsmen are waiting for the rain to stop, only then they can start to do their work.
12:30 Local Time, 06:30 GMT, 12:00 IST: Things are looking grim. This is what Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Lakes forming where the covers end at Fatullah......This is some rain!"

12:20 Local Time, 06:20 GMT, 11:50 IST: It's still lunch, but the scenes at Fatullah look very grim. It's very dark and the floodlights have taken full effect. The rain is pelting down. We will definitely have a long delay.

Dhawan continued to bat in a positive fashion and recorded his 3rd Test fifty off 47 balls, while Vijay played second fiddle to him. Bangladesh could have seen the back of Dhawan, but Shuvagata Hom dropped him at short mid-wicket just before rain stopped play. Both batsmen have hardly been troubled and the hosts need to put up a spirited show in the field when they come out after the rain break.

So a fruitful beginning to the Test match for India. Their captain, Virat Kohli, called the right side of the coin and had no hesitation in opting to bat first on a flat wicket. Openers Shikhar Dhawan and Murali Vijay played cautiously at the start, before the former upped the ante after getting his eye in. Vijay though got a reprieve early in the innings as he survived a close lbw call on 0 off Soumya Sarkar. The Bangladeshi bowlers, however, could not stem the run flow and soon lost the plot as they bowled freebies.
11:52 Local Time, 05:52 GMT, 11:22 IST: As expected, lunch has been taken early as it continues to rain.
11:46 Local Time, 05:46 GMT, 11:16 IST: The news is that the rain is quite heavy at the moment in Fatullah. So it is highly likely that they would take lunch early.

11:35 Local Time, 05:35 GMT, 11:05 IST: Oopsy! The drizzle has got heavier and the players are going off. The groundstaff rush with the covers. Initially, only the pitch was protected, but now the entire square has been covered.

Can India make 800? This is the pitch to do it if ever they wanted and hoped to achieve that figure and with all respect to Bangladesh's bowling attack, I don't see them taking more than 6 Indian wickets on this. When Dhawan reached fifty, Kohli was actually eating something - looked like chips or a biscuit, still clapped his mate's milestone

That will be the first hour and it will be drinks. One word to describe that hour's action - easy. Very easy for the Indian batsmen. The pitch is a typical Bangladeshi wicket which aids the spinners. But the bowling has been poor and too many gifts doled out. Dhawan has cashed in on those and reached fifty. Can he make a hundred inside a session? This is his best chance. Long day in the field today and probably tomorrow as well awaits Bangladesh

So no place for Cheteshwar Pujara, despite his good recent showing in England, where he played for Yorkshire. Rohit Sharma batted at three during the SCG Test and will continue to hold that position. A comeback for Harbhajan Singh as well, he will feature in his first Test since playing against Australia at home in 2013. Varun Aaron is back as well. He replaces Bhuvneshwar Kumar. A debutant for Bangladesh. Litton Das becomes the 77th player to wear the national cap.
Teams:
Bangladesh (Playing XI): Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Mushfiqur Rahim(c), Shakib Al Hasan, Soumya Sarkar, Litton Das(w), Shuvagata Hom, Jubair Hossain, Taijul Islam, Mohammad Shahid
India (Playing XI): Murali Vijay, Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli(c), Ajinkya Rahane, Wriddhiman Saha(w), Ravichandran Ashwin, Harbhajan Singh, Ishant Sharma, Umesh Yadav, Varun Aaron

Rahim: 'Looks like a flat track, but as the Test progresses, it will become slower. Unlucky to lose the toss, but we need to restrict them to a modest score. We are playing three spinners plus Shakib. We played well against Pakistan, the boys are very confident. We are looking forward to a good Test.'

Kohli: 'We will bat first, looks like a pretty nice and hard wicket. It's the beginning of the full-time job, pretty excited, hopefully, we can put up a strong performance. I never thought I will be India's Test captain at 26. God has been kind, I have worked hard, at the end of the day, I have the opportunity to do something special for the team. I think a lot about the game, I like to find new ideas. It's very exciting to get into the psyche of the batsmen. We are playing six batsmen, three seamers and two spinners. Dhawan replaces KL Rahul. We have Ashwin and Harbhajan as well.'
India have won the toss and have opted to bat
Time for the toss..
There's a concern about the wicket-keeper for Bangladesh as well. Will Rahim keep? If he doesn't, Litton Das will make his Test debut and will play as the keeper.

Early Team news: There will be at least one change to the Indian team that last featured in a Test match, at SCG, against Australia. Illness prevented opener, KL Rahul, from travelling and he will be replaced by Shikhar Dhawan. Ravichandran Ashwin is a sure starter. But will India go in with three spinners? If so, then both Harbhajan Singh and Karn Sharma will feature in the playing XI, else one will miss out. Ishant Sharma and Umesh Yadav are likely to open with the new-ball. Kohli said he is a big fan of playing five bowlers. That will mean only one of Cheteshwar Pujara or Rohit Sharma will feature in the playing eleven.

Skipper, Mushfiqur Rahim, has oozed confidence and believes his team has it in them to upstage the more famed neighbours. "For me, playing against India gives me extra motivation as the entire cricketing world will be watching the series with a lot of interest. When we beat Pakistan in the ODI series, critics said that it was not a quality team. So there is extra bit of motivation for me to do well against India," he said.

But it's not just India who will be playing today. Hosts, Bangladesh, have things to prove as well. While they have lifted their game in the shorter forms of the game, they have remained slack in the longer format of the game. They have the goods, they have upped their game in recent times. The comeback from behind to draw against Pakistan remains fresh in memory. The young batsmen have finally learnt the art of batting in Tests. But can they take 20 wickets? That's one area that remains a concern for this Bangladeshi line-up.

Come June 2015, Kohli will begin a new era. He's now firmly in the hot seat. There will be no MS Dhoni to guide him on his way. Thankfully for him, India will not be travelling overseas anytime soon. One can say it's a soft start as well. With all respect, Bangladesh haven't proved to be as intimidating in Tests as they have been in the shorter formats of the game. Kohli isn't taking things easy though. This is what he said just before India left for the tour. "We are looking for a fresh start. I'm looking forward to plan what will hopefully be a good 3-4 years," he said. Can he motivate his troops and make India a top Test team once again?

Virat Kohli was formally anointed as India's Test captain at the start of 2015. He didn't compromise his aggression, but at the same time, showed that he could adapt to the modern challenges. When Dhoni missed out in the first Test at Adelaide, Kohli walked the talk. He batted in a supreme fashion - making hundreds in both innings. India promised that they would go for the target. At tea on the final day, they were well within reach, only for the familiar Indian batting collapse to undo all the good work. When he was back as captain, for the Sydney Test, he wasn't going to make the same mistake once again. India battled hard and saved the Test. They had lost the series, but the promise of a better future was written all over.

This young and brash India was led by a captain who had seen it and experienced it all in the shorter forms of the game. However, MS Dhoni, the Test captain couldn't match MS Dhoni - the ODI skipper. He led from the front, but at times, India seemed to lack that killer punch, the aggression that made teams like Australia and South Africa - world beaters in the Test format. It is to his credit that Dhoni steered the ship, allowed the youngsters to get a feel of what Test cricket was all about before announcing his retirement and passing the baton to Virat Kohli - his long time successor, at the end of the Australian tour.

India begin their long journey towards Test revival with tiny steps. First up in a long and hectic international calendar will see them playing Bangladesh in a short series comprising of one Test and three ODIs. An inexperienced team India fought hard in South Africa, New Zealand, England and Australia. The fab four were replaced by a new generation of cricketers. They were mainly fed on the T20 diet, but they showed that they can play the longer form of the game with equal ease as well.

Preview:
A lot has changed since India and Bangladesh last played a Test match. Virender Sehwag, who famously remarked that Bangladesh didn't have the bowling to take 20 wickets, isn't around. Nor are the other members of the then fabled Indian middle-order. India aren't the top-ranked Test side anymore and could slip down to seventh if they lose while Bangladesh have won more Test matches in the last five years than they did before 2010. However, the hosts' proclivity to take those 20 wickets remain questionable.

After 18 months of playing only overseas Tests, India return to red-ball cricket in the familiar surroundings of the sub-continent. Virat Kohli starts his first full international season as Test captain with a one-off match against Bangladesh. Despite unfavourable results in South Africa, New Zealand, England and Australia and the subsequent slide in the rankings, the young Indian side showed a lot of pedigree. A win against Bangladesh should help reinforce their belief and hold them in good stead for the sterner tests to follow.

Bangladesh cricket is going through its renaissance. Their run to the quarter-finals of the World Cup was followed by a thrashing of Pakistan in the limited overs series. However, despite running their opponents close on many occasions, Bangladesh remain a work-in-progress in the longer format. A one-off Test gives them another opportunity to assess their standing.

Start Date: 10th June 2015

Venue: Khan Saheb Osman Ali Stadium, Fatullah

Start time: 09:30 IST, 04:00 GMT

Weather: Hot and Humid with a high of 36 degree Celsius and a 10% chance of showers.

Team News:

Bangladesh:

Bangladesh have selection issues ahead of the Test exacerbated by injury to senior batsman Mohammad Mahmudullah. Nasir Hossain, who last played in the series against West Indies in September 2014, could replace him in the eleven and double up as an off-spinner. There are also concerns over captain Mushfiqur Rahim's workload after he sustained a finger injury during the Pakistan Tests and is likely to handover keeping duties to Litton Das. Speedster Rubel Hossain's return to fitness, however, would relieve the Bangladesh supporters especially in the aftermath of Shahdat Hossain's long-term injury.

Probable XI: Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Shakib Al Hasan, Mushfiqur Rahim (c), Soumya Sarkar, Litton Das (wk) Shuvagata Hom, Taijul Islam, Mohammad Shahid, Rubel Hossain

India:

India will return to the opening pair of Shikhar Dhawan and Murali Vijay following KL Rahul's late withdrawal due to illness. With a mixed county cricket experience behind him, Cheteshwar Pujara should return to the playing eleven after facing the axe in the New Year's Test in Sydney. It remains to be seen, however, if he will return to his usual position at No. 3 or swap places with Rohit Sharma. The returning Harbhajan Singh is likely to partner fellow off-spinner R Ashwin to counter the left-handers in the Bangladeshi ranks while the think-tank will weigh up Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Umesh Yadav for the second pacer's slot.

Probable XI: Shikhar Dhawan, Murali Vijay, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli (c), Ajinkya Rahane, Rohit Sharma, Wriddhiman Saha, Ravichandran Ashwin, Harbhajan Singh, Ishant Sharma, Umesh Yadav/Bhuvneshwar Kumar

Stats and Trivia:

- Shakib Al Hasan needs five runs and a wicket to complete 2000 runs and 100 wickets in Bangladesh

- Mominul Haque stands a chance to equal AB de Villiers' record of having scored the most number of fifties in consecutive Tests (12).

Quotes:

"We have learnt in the past few Test matches but starting now, we want to start achieving the results we really want, not to go away from every Test match thinking we have learnt from it"

- India captain Virat Kohli lays down the marker when asked about his team's goals.

"I am nowhere near him, you know he is the king of all forms of cricket"

- An embarrassed Mominul Haque on comparisons with AB de Villiers.
Teams:

Bangladesh (From): Tamim Iqbal, Imrul Kayes, Mominul Haque, Mushfiqur Rahim(c), Shakib Al Hasan, Litton Das(w), Soumya Sarkar, Shuvagata Hom, Taijul Islam, Jubair Hossain, Rubel Hossain, Nasir Hossain, Mohammad Shahid, Abul Hasan

India (From): Murali Vijay, Shikhar Dhawan, Cheteshwar Pujara, Virat Kohli(c), Ajinkya Rahane, Rohit Sharma, Wriddhiman Saha(w), Ravichandran Ashwin, Harbhajan Singh, Ishant Sharma, Umesh Yadav, Karn Sharma, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Varun Aaron
